titleproper.value: Guide to the Abraham Lincoln Brigade Archives Films. <num>ALBA.FILM.001</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Erika Gottfried and Kiron Johnson

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-10-03T20:06:45</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

extent.value: in 3 record cartons and 1 manuscript box.

abstract.value: Collection consists of films, videos, and DVDs on the Spanish Civil War, the Abraham Lincoln Brigade,  and Spanish Republican refugees,  including a 1938 documentary short directed by Henri Cartier –Bresson, "With the Lincoln Brigade in Spain"; footage shot by Harry Randall, member of the Lincoln Brigade itself, in 1937-1938; a 1939 documentary film directed by Jean-Paul Le Chanois (aka Jean-Paul Dreyfuss) entitled "Refuge," about exiled Spanish Republicans in French refugee camps; and an episode from a 1978 television documentary series on the Spanish Civil War.

p.value: Repository permission is required for access. Please contact the Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives for more information and to schedule an appointment, tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu or 212-998-2630.
Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; reel or cassette number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
• Sills, Sam. "Abraham Lincoln Brigade." In The Encyclopedia of the American Left, Second Edition. Eds.Mari Jo Buhle, Paul Buhle, and Dan Georgakas. New York: Oxford University Press, 1998. 2-4.

The footage shot by Randall includes soldiers (presumably Abraham Lincoln Brigade members and possibly Spanish soldiers as well) at the front and behind the front lines, marching, training, and relaxing, Spanish peasants planting, and scenes of war-caused destruction.  "With the Abraham Lincoln Brigade in Spain" documents Brigade members in Spain, training near the front, waiting to be mobilized, wounded, and at hospitals. It includes close-ups of Brigade members, the nurses who treated them, and local residents Brigaders met while recovering from their wounds, as well as scenes of Madrid during the fall of 1937, and a soccer game in Benicassim.

corpname.value: Spain. Ejercito Popular de la Republica. Brigada Internacional, XV

Spanish Civil War (Spanish Audio); Cuban Film 1948; [SOMETIMES CALLED "BENE CASIM"]" [VHS]. cuid7578456199Apr. 24, 200322"Abraham Lincoln Brigade" "In Spain 1938" [2] [VHS].cuid7579456200May 23, 200323"Abraham Lincoln Brigade Archive; Spanish Civil War Footage; 28 min (audio in English); 24 min (MOS); 11 min (audio in Spanish)." cuid7580456201undated24Spanish Civil War Harry Randall Footage Circa 37-38 Benicasim [Digibeta, Transfer].cuid7581456259undated25: [31142050279523]"Spanish Civil War" Jesse Crawford 16mm Transfer @ 12fps Harry Randall Film Spain 1937-38 Master [Digibeta "Film Transfer"].cuid7582456260199726: [31142050279580]"The Abraham Lincoln Brigade in Spain" and "Otro Crimen de Franco"cuid75834563451937, 194827: [31142050279564]Digitized Access FilesALBA.Film.001_cuid7583Scope and Contents

Two films related to the Spanish Civil War, one is a copy of Henri Cartier-Bresson's The Abraham Lincoln Brigade in Spain, and the other a Spanish-language film called Otro Crimen de Franco made by Cuban filmmakers.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Digibeta, 37 min., Black and White, Silent and Sound

Note: A film print of Henri Cartier-Bresson's The Abraham Lincoln Brigade in Spain has been preserved. Preservation elements and digital derivatives are available.

"Spanish Civil War" Jesse Crawford 16mm Transfer & 12fps Harry Randall Film Spain 1937-38 [Digibeta, "Clone"].cuid7584456346undated28: [31142050279598]Abraham Lincoln Brigade [BetaSP].cuid7585456347undated29: [31142050279689]"Refuge"cuid75864563481939210: [31142050279648]Digitized Access FilesALBA.Film.001_cuid7586Scope and Contents

A video copy of the film Refuge directed by Jean-Paul Le Chanois (credited as Jean-Paul Dreyfus). The film was produced by the North American Committee to Aid Spanish Democracy.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Digibeta, 28 min, Black and White, Sound

Note: This is a telecine transfer from 16mm film; voiceover in English.

Existence and Location of Copies

A 16mm film print of Refuge exists in this collection.
